newsitem.title: UK: Silk Cut promotes its brand at UK discos.
newsitem.headline: Silk Cut promotes its brand at UK discos.

text.p: The makers of Silk Cut cigarettes said on Thursday they had been promoting their brand by draping purple silk around several discotheques in Britain.

Gallaher, the tobacco company that makes Silk Cut and is a part of American Brands Inc, told Reuters it had sponsored a series of parties at discos in Britain since March and the campaign would end next week.
Gallaher is running the parties, called the Renaissance Silk Grand Tour, in conjunction with the Renaissance Group, one of Britain's leading night club promoters.
A spokesman for Gallaher said: "There is no overt Silk Cut branding but venues around the country will be draped with purple silk."

Silk and the colour purple are a strong element in the company's long running advertising campaign created by M & C Saatchi. It features images of purple silk slashed by scissors, cacti and a rhinoceros horn.
Gallaher said it did offer people attending the parties sample packs of cigarettes.
Advertising tobacco products in Britain is restricted.
Cigarette product sampling campaigns are legal, but companies are only allowed to target existing smokers aged over 18 who have to sign a document confirming they already smoke and are over 18.
Gallaher declined to say how much it was spending on the disco parties. The spokesman said, "We felt it was the right sort of event with which we want Silk Cut associated."
